brainly_data.question: If a rubik’s cube has a volume of 384 cubic centimeters, how long is one side of the cube? (recall that the volume of a cube is calculated by 2003-04-02-00-00_files/i0120000.jpg, where l is the length of one side.)
brainly_data.subject: Mathematics

all_answers.question: If a rubik’s cube has a volume of 384 cubic centimeters, how long is one side of the cube? (recall that the volume of a cube is calculated by 2003-04-02-00-00_files/i0120000.jpg, where l is the length of one side.)
all_answers.subject: Mathematics
all_answers.text: Volume is normally V=x to the power of 3 instead you would do the opposite which is square root it. So it would be the cube root of 384 which is 7.26848237113 which is about 7.3
